newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine leader sues opponent for mafia comment.
newsitem.headline: Argentine leader sues opponent for mafia comment.

text.p: Argentine President Carlos Menem on Friday sued a former aide turned political opponent who sought to discredit Menem's anti-corruption campaign by likening him to a mafia boss.

The lawsuit filed in federal court charges that Gustavo Beliz, Menem's former interior minister and current leader of a fledgling political movement, attacked the "honor" of the Peronist president. It also named two top editors of the Pagina/12 newspaper as defendants for a bold front-page headline that it charged maliciously drew a direct link between Menem and the mafia.
Menem, who has initiated similar lawsuits in the past, wants a retraction from Beliz and from editors Fernando Socolowicz and Ernesto Tiffenberg.

Beliz's comments came after Menem announced an anti-corruption crusade to root graft from the public service. He was Menem's interior minister from 1992-1993 but left alleging the government was a "viper's nest" of corruption.
He formed the New Leadership party and was soundly defeated in Buenos Aires mayoral elections this year.

The lawsuit quotes Beliz as saying, "Society does not believe the president when he says he will fight against the mafia because a large part of the public sees him almost as the boss or responsible for this type of attitude."
It adds that the daily, which ran a headline saying "Menem is the mafia boss" next to a large picture of Beliz, "reproduced the injurious comments with a touch of malice."
Beliz was referring to several government officials who have left office under suspicion of corruption.
"Saying someone is the head of the mafia attacks his honour," the lawsuit says.
Former Economy Minister Domingo Cavallo accused two cabinet ministers this week of covering up corruption and manipulating judges. The government denied the charges.
The World Bank and International Monetary Fund recently urged Argentina to intensify its efforts to crack down on corruption.
